articles.title: Forcible Disbandment of Legitimate Political Party Denounced
articles.content:
Forcible Disbandment of Legitimate Political Party Denounced
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet forces committed such a fascist act of forcibly disbanding the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) and depriving lawmakers from the party of their membership as "National Assemblymen". 
					 A spokesman for the Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea in a statement Monday branded the puppet authorities' act of disbanding the party by deliberately linking its programme with the DPRK and terming the party "a political party violating constitution through pursuance to the north" as a wanton violation of democracy and human rights and an unprecedented politically-motivated terrorist act.
					
					 The Democratic Lawyers Association of Korea branded the Park Geun Hye group's act of forcibly disbanding the UPP as an unwarranted fascist one that totally denies the elementary requirements in the light of law and an outrageous, mediaeval and tyrannical act that crudely violates the freedom of expression and assembly to turn south Korea into a political hell, the spokesman said, and went on:
					
					 It is not the dark era of the last century when anti-communist McCarthyism prevailed and strong wind of fascism raged. But the legitimate political party was disbanded in the 21st century, a crime against humanity that runs diametrically counter to the trend of the times and the universal rights of humankind.
					
					 It is the height of shamelessness that the fascist tyrants and biggest human rights abusers who wantonly violate elementary political freedom and democratic rights of human being are raising a hue and cry over the "human rights issue" of the north.
					
					 Moreover, the present south Korean chief executive praised the recent fascist act as a "historical decision." This proves that Park Geun Hye has been behind it and she tries to revive the departed soul of "yusin" dictatorship.
					
					 The puppet conservative group's act of disbanding the UPP at the point of bayonets is aimed to wipe out the progressive democratic forces and put down the struggle of opposition parties through the wind of the "forces following the north" to prevent it from seizing power again. It is also aimed to calm down the public criticism focused on it due to the case of Jong Yun Hoe's interference in state affairs and thus tide over the ruling crisis.
					
					 It is clear that south Korea will turn into the tundra of human rights and democracy and that all political parties and organizations whom the group of traitors is displeased with will be subject to fascist suppression as long as those fascist hooligans seized by the ambition of long-term office and confrontation with fellow countrymen are left as they are.
					
					 The historical lesson proves that those who prolong their remaining days through fascist misrule will meet only ruin.

articles.title: Foreign Women Visit Pyongyang Baby Home, Orphanage
articles.content:
Foreign Women Visit Pyongyang Baby Home, Orphanage
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Foreign women of embassies here visited the Pyongyang Baby Home and Orphanage on Monday on the occasion of the 97th anniversary of the birth of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
					 Being briefed on the fact that orphans' home was splendidly built on the picturesque bank of the Taedong River, they looked round the room for the education, exercise room, room for the intelligence games, outdoor and indoor wading pools, etc.
					
					 They were deeply admired to see the orphans leading a happy life with nothing to desire more in the world.
					
					 At the end of the visit they made entries in the visitor's book.

articles.title: Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A wreath was laid before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong on Monday by women of foreign embassies and missions of international bodies here on the occasion of her 97th birth anniversary.
					 They paid silent tribute to her after laying the wreath.

articles.title: Persimmon Popular in DPRK
articles.content:
Persimmon Popular in DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Korean people have cultivated persimmon from long ago.
					 More than 40 species of persimmon have been cultivated in the country, which takes a considerable share in its fruit growing, said Dr. Kang Su Ik at Wonsan University of Agriculture.
					
					 He said that especially in winter, fresh or dried persimmon is catching eyes of housewives. 
					
					 Fresh persimmon is of high nutritive and medicinal value as it abounds with glucose, sucrose, Vitamin C, malic and citric acids, iron, calcium, copper, manganese, etc., he added.

articles.title: Downfall of U.S. Is Historic Necessity: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Downfall of U.S. Is Historic Necessity: Rodong Sinmun 
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Joseph Nye, professor at Harvard University in the U.S. who was deeply involved in shaping diplomacy and security policies of the Democratic Party, explained at the recent 7th World Policy Conference that the present geopolitical crises worsened everywhere including the Mideast, Ukraine, Northeast Asia and other places are attributable to the weak strength of the U.S. and dispersion of power. Meanwhile, Richard Haass, former State Department official who participated a lot in working out diplomacy and security policies of the Republican Party, made an analysis that the U.S.-dominated world structure has already lost its strength and the number of the countries aware of the U.S. when diplomatic policies are determined greatly decreased.
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a commentary in this regard.
					
					 The commentary says:
					
					 Such deploring voices among policy experts in the U.S. prove once again that the U.S. is being reduced to dregs of history.
					
					 This is the sealed fate of the U.S. 
					
					 The sound of gunfire has never stopped on this planet since the U.S. made its blood-stained appearance in the world.
					
					 The world is shaking with rage, witnessing the brutal infringement upon sovereignty and human rights abuses. Struggles for independence against the U.S. are going on in various parts of the world. The efforts of different countries are being increased to build a multipolar world to cope with the U.S. moves for a unipolar world.
					
					 Meanwhile, the strength of the U.S. is now waning day by day.
					
					 No matter how desperately the U.S. may roar, it is nothing but roar of a toothless wolf.
					
					 The incarnation of all sorts of evil, the empire of devils, is bound to grow old and go to ruin. This is the law governing the historical development.
					
					 The last-ditch efforts on the part of the U.S. can never change this law governing the historical development.

articles.title: U.S. Is Unchangeable Principal Enemy of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
U.S. Is Unchangeable Principal Enemy of DPRK: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The trend of the situation on the Korean Peninsula this year clearly shows that it is none other than the U.S. which is the arch criminal disturbing the efforts for creating a peaceful environment on the Korean Peninsula and bringing the danger of a new war and that it remains the unchangeable principal enemy of the DPRK. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday says this in an article.
					
					 The U.S. has persistently stepped up its hostile policy towards the DPRK throughout the year, threatening and blackmailing the DPRK by force of arms, the article notes and goes on:
					
					 This year the U.S. reached a more reckless phase in its moves to stamp out politically, isolate economically and stifle the DPRK by force of arms.
					
					 It made a last-ditch effort to disarm the DPRK by taking issue with every step it took to bolster up war deterrence for self-defence.
					
					 The U.S. reached the height in its moves to break the single-minded unity and infringe upon the sovereignty of the DPRK through a criminal "human rights" offensive this year.
					
					 The U.S. was hit hard by the DPRK's toughest counteraction. Yet, it went so foolish as to present itself as a "victor" by distorting and fabricating the history of defeat.  This is another trend manifested in the U.S.-DPRK relations. 
					
					 It was a shameless tradition of the U.S. imperialists in which it was always hit hard and sustained setbacks whereas it was a proud tradition of the DPRK in which it has smashed every machination of the U.S. that went reckless, counting on its strength.
					
					 The review of this year's DPRK-U.S. relations shows that the U.S. imperialists are the unchangeable principal and sworn enemy of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK will surely settle accounts with the U.S. imperialists and give vent to its pent-up grudge, the article concludes.

articles.title: Why Does S. Korean Regime Keep Mum about U.S. Monstrous Human Rights Abuses?: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Why Does S. Korean Regime Keep Mum about U.S. Monstrous Human Rights Abuses?: Rodong Sinmun
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- World public is becoming increasingly vocal protesting and condemning the U.S. over the disclosed shuddering torture committed by the CIA.
					 This being a hard reality, it is only the south Korean puppet forces that are keeping mum about the monstrous human rights abuses of their American master but noisily trumpeting about the non-existent "human rights" issue in the DPRK.
					
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday in a commentary terms the south Korean puppet forces pro-U.S. stooges and colonial servants making profound confusion of right and wrong.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 The south Korean puppet authorities are malignantly slandering the DPRK while pretending ignorance of the cruel human rights abuses of the U.S. Why? By doing so, they are to please their master and divert public criticism and denunciation focused on the U.S. to the DPRK.
					
					 Another reason is that they seek to get rid of their worst ruling crisis by escalating the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					
					 Those stooges have neither qualification nor face to talk about inviolable human rights as they are not in a position to say any proper words about the human rights abuses of their master.
					
					 No matter what rhetoric the puppet forces may let loose, that is no more than absurd sophism let loose by the colonial stooge of the U.S. in the tundra of human rights bereft of sovereignty.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Frantic "Human Rights" Racket
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams S. Korean Puppet Group's Frantic "Human Rights" Racket
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet group's anti-DPRK "human rights" conspiratorial racket has reached its height, as evidenced by its zealous move to submit a letter requesting the UN Security Council to make the "human rights issue" of the DPRK its agenda item, says Rodong Sinmun Monday in an article.
					 The puppet group is going desperate in its moves to tarnish the image of the most advantageous socialist system in the DPRK and ratchet up international sanctions and pressure on it by abusing the UN and, at the same time, shake the steel-strong faith deeply rooted in the hearts of the service personnel and people of the DPRK, notes the article, and goes on:
					
					 Human rights issue has never existed and can never do under the Korean style socialist system centered on the popular masses.
					
					 The fair-minded world public is branding the anti-DPRK "human rights" racket kicked up by the puppet group as an anachronistic reckless one, while spitting at its ridiculous talk about "human rights."
					
					 Even those of the puppet group are calling for making a switchover in its "policy toward the north", warning it of the grave consequences to be entailed by its reckless anti-DPRK "human rights" racket.
					
					 The puppet group, failing to mind its own business, dares attempt to bring down the socialist system in the DPRK, the life and soul of its people, which reminds one of a crow dreaming of killing a phoenix. Such attempt is an unpardonable insult to the DPRK and provocation against it.
					
					 The puppet group should be aware that its evermore desperate anti-DPRK "human rights" racket will only add to its crimes for which it should pay dearly before all Koreans.

articles.title: Demos against S. Korean Puppet Forces' Hostile Policy toward DPRK Staged
articles.content:
Demos against S. Korean Puppet Forces' Hostile Policy toward DPRK Staged
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Public figures of south Korea have been staging demonstrations in Seoul from Dec. 16 to denounce the puppet forces for their hostile policy toward the DPRK, according to Thongil News, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 Ri Jang Hui, permanent representative of the Headquarters of the People's Movement for South-North Economic Cooperation, referred to the urgency of improving the south-north relations, saying it is almost 70 years since the division.
					
					 Ri urged the "government" authorities to lift the "May 24 steps" and rejuvenate south-north economic cooperation before talking about the "human rights in the north", adding:
					
					 The authorities should implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration upon which the south and the north already agreed before talking about "confidence-building process". The south-north relations that have shown no improvement are mainly ascribable to the hostile "policy toward the north" pursued by the authorities.
					
					 The south-north relations cannot make any progress as long as the authorities are seized with the logic of "collapse of the north and unification of social systems". The "government" should cancel the hostile confrontational policy at an early date and clarify the stand of implementing the declarations.

articles.title: Declaration on Situation Made Public in South Korea
articles.content:
Declaration on Situation Made Public in South Korea
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Representatives from trade unions and civic and public organizations of south Korea held a press conference in Seoul on Dec. 18 and made public a declaration on the situation making a review of the puppet authorities' two-year long rule ill-famed for fascist dictatorship and confrontation.
					 They termed two-year long rule by the Park Geun Hye "government" as the days of ruining people's living, violating democracy, suppressing workers and disturbing peace.
					
					 The present "government" sacrificed the Unified Progressive Party to tide over the ruling crisis caused by the Intelligence Service and other power organs' illegal interference in the election, they said, adding that it is making desperate efforts to get rid of the deplorable position it is now finding itself due to Jong Yun Hoe's interference in state affairs.
					
					 The freedom of assembly, demonstration, expression and speech was being violated in south Korea, they noted.
					
					 They blamed the Park Geun Hye "government" for pushing the south-north relations to an extreme phase through the confrontation with the fellow countrymen in the north.

articles.title: Moves for Joint Operation of MD Condemned in S. Korea
articles.content:
Moves for Joint Operation of MD Condemned in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- South Korean people from all walks of life held the 183rd action for independence, reunification and peace before the U.S. embassy in Seoul on Dec. 16 to denounce the U.S. moves to jointly operate missile defense system.
					 The participants accused the U.S. of working hard to attain its strategic goal of building triangular military alliance with south Korea and Japan through the joint operation of the MD and laying a siege network against the north and other parts in Northeast Asia.
					
					 They urged the U.S. to immediately stop such moves.

articles.title: "Constitutional Court" Flailed for Dissolving Political Party in S. Korea
articles.content:
"Constitutional Court" Flailed for Dissolving Political Party in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on Saturday carried an editorial titled "Death of democracy, death of constitutional court".
					 The editorial said the "constitutional court" made a decision on disbanding the Unified Progressive Party (UPP) on Friday, depriving lawmakers from the party of their membership as "National Assemblymen".
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The decision has neither evidence nor credible ground. The decision was passed on the minority political party for the reason that it is opposed to the will of many.
					
					 This has crudely violated democracy, putting democracy of south Korea in the danger of dissolution and disbandment.
					
					 The recent decision is a big blunder to be recorded in the judicial history.
					
					 Utterly unreasonable are the reason and justifications behind the recent decision.
					
					 It is an act ultra vires that the court deprived lawmakers from the UPP of their membership as "National Assemblymen".
					
					 So huge is the loss to society as freedom of political party and freedom of political assembly will be seriously violated due to the dissolution of the political party.
					
					 The political will of the majority of people who approved the progressive logic will be dismissed as "violation of constitution" and an "act following the north".
					
					 Today the UPP was ousted but no one can vouch who will be the next target.
					
					 Question concerning the ground for the existence of the "constitutional court" will surely be raised as a result of the violation of democracy by it.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Forces' Decision on Disbanding Progressive Political Party Flayed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Forces' Decision on Disbanding Progressive Political Party Flayed
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Voices of protest and denunciation of people of all circles in south Korea are growing stronger against the puppet forces that forcibly disbanded the Unified Progressive Party (UPP).
					 The Youth Solidarity of south Korea in a statement on Dec. 19 strongly denounced the decision made by the "constitutional court" on disbanding the UPP as an act of violating democracy.
					
					 The UPP is not an unconstitutional political party but it was disbanded as it stood against the Park Geun Hye regime, it said, adding that the decision is aimed to turn the situation in favor of the present regime now driven into a tight corner.
					
					 The Women's Solidarity of south Korea in a statement on the same day condemned the decision of the "constitutional court" as one for tiding over the crisis, pursuant to the retaliatory politics of the Park Geun Hye regime and much upset by the fall of the supporting rate for it.
					
					 The statement said they will make every possible effort not to have the history of darkness repeat itself.

articles.title: S. Korean Warmonger Incites War against North
articles.content:
S. Korean Warmonger Incites War against North 
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Choe Yun Hui, chairman of the south Korean puppet joint chiefs of staff, inspected forefront units of the puppet army, stirring up war fever on Dec. 18, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 He inspected a guard battalion in the joint security area of Panmunjom and the post of die-hard military gangsters who had perpetrated a military provocation against the DPRK shortly ago and other units, crying out for coping with someone's "provocation" and "punishing provocateurs".
					
					 He blustered "he would not leave them alone in fight" but "strongly back them through alliance with the U.S.," instigating soldiers to military confrontation.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Shut down Paper Jaju Minbo
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Accused of Trying to Shut down Paper Jaju Minbo
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Federation of Koreans in the U.S. released a commentary on Dec. 16 to condemn the south Korean puppet forces for suppressing progressive media.
					 The commentary recalled that the Seoul High Court made a decision on canceling the registration of Jaju Minbo, an internet paper of south Korea.
					
					 Just are the activities of Jaju Minbo which has reported only truth for the peaceful reunification of Korea and for national reconciliation and cooperation against war since its foundation, it said.
					
					 Jaju Minbo is known as conscientious media among overseas Koreans aspiring after the peaceful reunification of the country, it noted.
					
					 Unreasonable is the decision made by the court to shut down Jaju Minbo, not conservative media that antagonize the north and foster confrontation and contradiction between the north and the south, it pointed out.
					
					 Underscoring the need to ensure the activities of Jaju Minbo, it added: To try to ban the activities of progressive media is an act of opposing reunification.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Bangladesh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Bangladesh
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" was brought out in booklet by a publishing house in Dhaka, Bangladesh.
					 The work, published on Sep. 5, Juche 97 (2008), says that the DPRK's invincible might lies in defending and adhering to the Juche-oriented idea of President Kim Il Sung on building the state and his exploits and adding eternal shine to them.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on Dec. 15.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Exploits Lauded by Bangladeshi Figure
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Songun Revolutionary Leadership Exploits Lauded by Bangladeshi Figure
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- M. Jahangir Khan, chairman of the Bangladesh Group for the Study of the Songun Policy, praised the Songun revolutionary leadership exploits of leader Kim Jong Il at a ceremony of releasing his work "The Democratic People's Republic of Korea Is a Juche-Oriented Socialist State with Invincible Might" took place at a publishing house in Dhaka, Bangladesh on Dec. 15.
					 He made the following speech:
					
					 The DPRK became an invincible socialist power demonstrating its might of Songun under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its invincible might while smashing all the imperialists' moves to stifle it under the banner of Songun.
					
					 We will conduct positive activities of solidarity with the Korean people dynamically advancing to achieve the country's independent and peaceful reunification under the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Published in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Step Up the Building of a Thriving Country by Applying Kim Jong Il's Patriotism" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on Dec. 13.
					 The work, published on July 26, Juche 101 (2012), deals with the essence of Kim Jong Il's patriotism and his noble life featured by his love for the country and its people.
					
					 It also clarifies important matters arising in embodying Kim Jong Il's patriotism.
					
					 His work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" was brought out by the Dalkants Publishing House in Russia on Dec. 9.
					
					 The work, published on April 15, Juche 101 (2012), says that one hundred year-long history of Kim Il Sung's nation is the one clearly proving the immutable truth that an outstanding leader assures the dignity and prosperity of the country and nation.
					
					 It also indicates tasks to be fulfilled to add eternal shine to the dignity of Songun Korea and successfully accomplish the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and others.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Remembered in Various Countries
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Meetings for remembering leader Kim Jong Il took place in Syria, Serbia, Bulgaria and South Africa from Dec. 13 to 15.
					 Present at the meetings were figures of all strata and other masses in those countries.
					
					 Participants observed silent tribute to Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The director of the Higher Education Department of the Regional Leadership of the Syria's Baath Arab Socialist Party praised Kim Jong Il as the great leader who performed great exploits guaranteeing a rosy future of socialist Korea.
					
					 The general secretary of the New Yugoslav Communist Party of Serbia lauded Kim Jong Il as the outstanding thinker and theoretician, a great statesman, peerless Songun brilliant commander, tender-hearted father of the people and teacher of world progressives.
					
					 The acting chief of the Kim Il Sung Library in Sofia, Bulgaria praised the sacred revolutionary career of Kim Jong Il who was born as the son of guerrillas in Mt. Paektu, holy mountain of revolution.
					
					 The coordinator of a regional committee of the South African Communist Party stressed that Kim Jong Il was the great leader who devoted his whole life to the development of the Workers' Party of Korea, Korean people's happiness and triumph of the cause of global independence and they would always remember his exploits.
					
					 Messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the meetings held in Serbia, Bulgaria and South Africa.

articles.title: Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held in Germany, Bangladesh
articles.content:
Seminars on Kim Jong Il's Exploits Held in Germany, Bangladesh
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Communist Party of Germany, the Federal Republic of Germany－DPRK Association and the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea held seminars on leader Kim Jong Il's exploits on Dec. 13 on the occasion of the third anniversary of his demise.
					 Present at the seminars were figures of various circles, members of the organizations for the study of the Juche idea and organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and other masses in relevant countries.
					
					 Speakers including the chairman of the Communist Party of Germany lauded Kim Jong Il for developing the Workers' Party of Korea into President Kim Il Sung's party both in name and reality.
					
					 The vice-chairman of the Federal Republic of Germany-DPRK Association said that Kim Jong Il's demise was the biggest loss to the Korean people and other progressives in the world.
					
					 The chairman of the Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea and other speakers praised Kim Jong Il for ushering in a fresh era of prosperity unprecedented in a 5000-year-long history of the nation in the DPRK and putting the country's military power on the highest level with his Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 Messages to Marshal Kim Jong Un were adopted at the seminars held in Germany.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Lauded by Ghanaian, Egyptian Personages
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Lauded by Ghanaian, Egyptian Personages
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Ghanaian and Egyptian personages made public statements on Dec. 14 and 15 on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 The deputy general secretary of the National Democratic Congress of Ghana said:
					
					 I pay the highest tribute to HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, on behalf of the National Democratic Congress of Ghana.
					
					 The DPRK is demonstrating its might as a world's political and military power thanks to the wise leadership of HE Generalissimo Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 He energetically led the party and the revolution for a long period.
					
					 Rosy is the future of the Workers' Party of Korea led by HE Kim Jong Un who is identical to Kim Jong Il in idea and traits. 
					
					 Kim Jong Il will always be alive in the hearts of progressives of the world.
					
					 Abdul Radi, general secretary of the Progressive Youth League of Egypt, said:
					
					 December 17 is the third anniversary of demise of HE Kim Jong Il, great leader of the Korean people. 
					
					 He was the father and great leader of the people who devoted everything to the development of socialist Korea and happiness of its people.
					
					 He performed undying exploits for the youth movement of the DPRK and the movement of the world progressive youth. 
					
					 I pay the highest tribute to HE Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Show Held in Mongolia
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Show Held in Mongolia 
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- A Kimjongilia show took place in Ulan Bator, Mongolia on Dec. 15 on the occasions of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il, third anniversary of Marshal Kim Jong Un's assumption of office as supreme commander of the Korean People's Army and the 97th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk. 
					 On display at the venue of the show were photos showing the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 Immortal Kimjongilias in full bloom turned the venue of the show into fantastic scenery. 
					
					 Present at the show were personages of political parties and organizations including the National Democratic Party of Mongolia, the Kimjongilia Association of Mongolia and the Mongolia-Korea Friendship Society and other masses. 
					
					 The general secretary of the National Democratic Party of Mongolia said that Kimjongilias were in full bloom in Mongolia in cold winter, a vivid expression of the Mongolian people's reverence for Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The precious exploits Kim Jong Il performed by turning the DPRK into a powerful country by wisely leading its party, army and people will shine long, he added.

articles.title: Russian Papers Introduce Revolutionary Career and Exploits of Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Papers Introduce Revolutionary Career and Exploits of Kim Jong Il 
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- Russian newspapers ran special write-ups on the occasion of the third anniversary of demise of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					 Krasnoyarski Rabochi on Dec. 11 dedicated two pages to articles praising the revolutionary career and exploits of Kim Jong Il illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and other photos. 
					
					 Komsomolskaya Pravda on Dec. 12 dedicated a whole page to the special write-up under the title "Immortality and Three Years of Inheritance" illustrated with a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il and a photo of Marshal Kim Jong Un. 
					
					 The December issue of Serp I Molot carried an article titled "Comrade Kim Jong Il, great son of the Korean people and leader of the party and state, passed away on December 17, 2011" under the headline "DPRK" illustrated with his photo. 
					
					 The Nizhegorodskaya Pravda on Dec. 11 carried articles including "Devoted Service" and "True Picture of Korea" praising the feats performed by Kim Jong Il as father of the people under the headline "Believing in people as in Heaven" together with his photos.

articles.title: Short Biography of Kim Jong Il Carried in Senegalese Paper
articles.content:
Short Biography of Kim Jong Il Carried in Senegalese Paper
						
 Pyongyang, December 22 (KCNA) -- The Senegalese paper Observateur carried a brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il on Dec. 13.
					 It was accompanied by a portrait of smiling Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Comandancia del Frente Occidental del EPC advierte a banda surcoreana
articles.content:
Comandancia del Frente Occidental del EPC advierte a banda surcoreana
						
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- En visperas del fin de este ano y comienzo del ano nuevo, los titeres surcoreanos tratan de construir la torre de farol en el pico Aegi y repetir la "ceremonia de encendida del farol".
					Al respecto, la Comandancia del Frente Occidental del Ejercito Popular de Corea hizo publica ayer una informacion que sigue:
					
					Dicha "ceremonia" es un tipo de la guerra psicologica que tiene lugar para irritar al Norte (de Corea) bajo el rotulo de acto religioso.
					
					A nuestro ejercito no le importa lo que hagan los titeres surcoreanos en su casa. Pero, no estara con brazos cruzados ni pasara por alto esa extrana farsa conflictiva y psicologica en la zona de la Linea de Demarcacion Militar, incluso en la cara de los oficiales y soldados del frente occidental.
					
					La "ceremonia de encendida del farol", producto de la siniestra intencion de la banda de Park Geun-hye de enfrentarse con la parte connacional, deviene un insulto insoportable y burla a nuestros uniformados en el frente y la directa declaracion de guerra.
					
					Insatisfechos de haber lanzado la campana de enfrentamiento fratricida a lo largo del ano, los compinches de Park Geun-hye tratan de cometer hasta en los dias finales de este ano otro acto de guerra psicologica anti-RPDC.
					
					Los oficiales y soldados del frente occidental ya habian demostrado con acciones cuan despiadada es la voluntad de venganza del EPC cuando aquellos ejecutaron en la zona de Linea de Demarcacion Militar la "operacion de lanzamiento de globos con volantes de contenido anti-RPDC" desoyendo la repetida advertencia.
					
					Los titeres surcoreanos no deben olvidar ni un momento que los soldados y habitantes de la RPDC entraron ya en la batalla de enfrentamiento intransigente.

articles.title: Extranjeras en Corea visitan hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang
articles.content:
Extranjeras en Corea visitan hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang
						
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 97o aniversario del nacimiento de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa Kim Jong Suk, las mujeres de las embajadas de varios paises en Corea visitaron el dia 22 el hospicio y orfanato de Pyongyang.
					Escuchando explicaciones sobre la edificacion magnifica del hospicio y orfanato a las orillas del pintoresco rio Taedong, las visitantes recorrieron las salas de educacion y juegos intelectuales, el gimnasio, la piscina al aire libre y bajo techo, etc.
					
					Se quedaron muy impresionadas al ver a los huerfanos que crecen felizmente sin envidar nada a nadie.
					
					Al final del recorrido, ellas firmaron el libro de visitas.

articles.title: Extranjeras rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Extranjeras rinden homenaje a Kim Jong Suk
						
Pyongyang, 22 de diciembre (ACNC) -- Con motivo del 97o aniversario del natalicio de la Heroina de la Lucha Antijaponesa, Kim Jong Suk, las mujeres de las embajadas de varios paises y de las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales, acreditadas en Corea, depositaron el dia 22 una ofrenda floral ante el busto de ella en el Cementerio de Martires Revolucionarios del Monte Taesong y guardaron un momento de silencio.
